Oct 1, 2004 Add bookmark #6 the episode when Calire Kincaid's character left the show was heartbreaking. glad it was so dramatic instead of "gee Jack I found another job". Always love to spot the "relationship" clues as well. added much to the story for me. Oct 1, 2004 Add bookmark #7 Claire. Claire Kincaid.

And yes, Jill Hennessy. Hands down. There's simply no contest. Oct 1, 2004 Add bookmark #8 Elizabeth Rohm is horrible. She can't deliver a line to save her life. You'd think for a drama like Law & Order, they would want to cast someone who has at least a tiny bit of voice acting talent. Oct 1, 2004 Add bookmark #9 Who are the two that voted for Serena? PISTOLS AT DAWN! I'll take you singly or as the pair!

I never knew they could make a robot actress out of wood until I saw this stupid blonde. Maybe that's what Rohm is going for or something, but jeez, she sounds like a... a... something really bad. It's like Captain Kirk goes to law school and becomes his own woman. Oct 1, 2004 Add bookmark #11 I'm seriously torn between Angie Harmon and Carey Lowell.

Angie Harmon....so hot. And her "tough stance" act just made her even hotter. Seriously, I've never seen a woman look so hot being pissed off all the time. Amazing. Oct 2, 2004 Add bookmark #14 Jill Hennessy is not only beautiful but she was the strongest actress out of all of them. Carrie Lowell didn't make that much of an impression on me although I did enjoy the harsh quitting and seperation (not romantic) between McCoy and her (did they ever apologize and stay friends?). Angie Harmon is surprisingly good for a model but I thought her character was looser and crazier than McCoy, so it didn't seem an appropriate duo. The blonde is a blonde. I also didn't like the fact that Adam Schiff left.

It was sad that Jill went, but her time on the show was excellent. She was the grounding force behind crazy ol Jack McCoy (that guy is great). Oct 2, 2004 Add bookmark #15 I'm going with Angie Harmon on this although my real fav is Diane Neal as Casey Novak on SVU. Oct 2, 2004 Add bookmark #16

unfortunatelly he's not longer on the show because the actor who played Schiff died. he was definitelly the best DA. I really don't like the new DA.

as for the second chairs... except for Serena, they all have their good points.
Abbie Carmichael is the hottest and the most aggressive. this sucked sometimes though when she'd be even more "rawr, let's get him!" than Jack.

Claire Kincaid was my favorite. she was tough but balanced Jack out well.

Jamie Ross was pretty cool and definitelly had her moments, but didn't have the fire that Kincaid and Carmichael did. Oct 2, 2004 Add bookmark #18
quote:
unfortunatelly he's not longer on the show because the actor who played Schiff died.


???

The IMDB and "deadoraliveinfo.com" both disagree with you. Steven Hill is currently 82 and apparently retired. Oct 2, 2004 Add bookmark #19 Jill Hennessy definitely has it going on in both looks, acting, and the role she played. That was an excellent character. But, I voted Angie Harmon. She took it over the edge with her tough stance on crime. She was hardcore.

Paul Robinette always looked like he had constipation. He just didn't step up with a strong personality. Jamie Ross was cool. Her disapproval of Jack McCoy made for an interesting dynamic, But both Hennessy and Harmon were better.

Serena, I think has gotten shafted. She came in during the dark era of Diane Wiest as DA. Everything was bad about those seasons. The dialog was too PC. Serena's character suffered for it and still suffers for it. She is too liberal for my tastes. I'm more of a "get the rope" kind of person like Angie Harmon's character.

Best DA is definitely Adam Schiff. The new DA, Arthur Branch is pretty cool. He's very political, using his public office in different ways than Schiff, who used back channel connections more. This ads an interesting element. But the era with Diane Wiest as interim DA... that does not exist. Not only was she horrible, but the general writing for those debates amongst DA, EADA, and ADA were wooden and namby pamby. They lost their passion and just seemed to be spiting out all the common angles of each issue.

With Schiff and Branch, the debates are more passionate and characterized by other factors, such as political motivations, public impression, conviction count. Oct 2, 2004 Add bookmark #20 Best second chair on Law and Order?

Jill Hennessy may be hot, but Angie Harmon's hot and her character was better imo. And like BraveHamster said ". . . her 'tough stance' act just made her even hotter." So that just puts the nail in the coffin. Oct 4, 2004 Add bookmark #24 My favorite L&O moment (even more than some of McCoy's brilliant oration or Stone's walking a witness back into a corner) is the episode witht eh serial killer who stashed the bodies in Central Park, and was wanted in Texas. Abbie delivered this brilliant bit during plea negotiations. She threatened the defendant with speedy execution in Texas etc. It was glorious.

I can just picture her at a sentencing hearing saying
quote:
Your honor, I'd like to execute the defendant bu ripping his throat out with my teeth and then bating in the fountain of blood.
And when those bounty hunters were in town, and she was trying so hard to be professional and prosecute them, but had this look on her face along the lines of "I know I'm supposed to prosecute them, but they're chasing bad guys. And look at those biceps. Must not run my finger along them. Jack, take care of this. I'll be in the bathroom for a few minutes."

I've got this one picture of Angie where she's on a bed in a t-shirt and panties, reading from a legal pad. I like to picture her working up a capital case looking like that.

Steven Hill left the show because he also left the plane of existence which the rest of us inhabit. Oct 4, 2004 Add bookmark #25
